item.description: Working nine years for the same company is pretty unusual in the tech industry. item.title: Rewriting the GNU Coreutils in Rust
item.description: As movement toward memory-safe languages, and Rust in particular, continues to grow, it is worth looking at one of the larger scale efforts to port C code that has existed for decades to Rust. The uutils project aims to rewrite all of the individual utilities included in the GNU Coreutils project in Rust. Originally created by Jordi Boggiano in 2013, the project aims to provide drop-in replacements for the Coreutils programs, adding the data-race protection and memory safety that Rust provides.
item.author: (June 8, 2021 This article was contributed by Ayooluwa Isaiah)
